security: Disclosing the details of this recruitment attempt could reveal intelligence-gathering methods and potentially compromise the safety of the volunteer and other Peace Corps personnel. Quoting the document: "PCD SAID THE RECRU! TMENT ATTEMPT WAS MADE AROUND 29 AUGUST 1977."
summary: A cable reports a Peace Corps volunteer in Bluefields, Nicaragua, was approached by an individual named Victor Paneque Batista, who identified himself as a 'CIA operative' and attempted to recruit her as an intelligence agent.
summary_one_paragraph: This secret cable dated September 13, 1977, reports that a Peace Corps Director (PCD) informed the CIA that Victor Paneque Batista, claiming to be a 'CIA operative', approached a Peace Corps volunteer in Bluefields, Nicaragua, around August 29, 1977, in an attempt to recruit her as an intelligence agent. The PCD mentioned that Paneque, who rented a house to the volunteer, is known to drink heavily and, when drunk, claims to be a CIA agent and a Bay of Pigs veteran. The station has two cards on an individual with the same name; one is filed under 201-2286382 and identifies him as a Cuban citizen who serves as a source of information concerning MDC activities.
title: Report of Alleged CIA Recruitment Attempt in Nicaragua
